## Biography

I will be a tenure-track assistant professor **(Principal Investigator)** at the Data Management Innovation Research Center, **Nanjing University**. My research expertise lies in **Science of Science**, **Complex Networks**, and **Scientometrics**. I am particularly interested in the career development paths of young scholars and the mechanisms of academic mentorship.

My recent research, published in ***Nature Human Behaviour***, explores how academic group size influences mentee's scientific career. This work has been highlighted by [***Nature News***: "How a PhD student’s lab size affects their chance of future academic success"](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-025-00644-9).

## News
* **[2026.01]** Since **2026.01**, I have been serving as an independent PI at **Nanjing University**.
* **[2025.03]** Our work on mentorship published in ***Nature Human Behaviour*** is featured by [**Nature News**](https://www.nature.com/articles/d41586-025-00644-9)!
* **[2024.08]** New preprint available: "Exaptation: Academic mentees' career pathway to be independent and impactful."

## Research Interests

* **Science of Science**: Mentorship dynamics, career trajectories, and academic independence.
* **Complex Systems**: Network resilience, cascading failures, and structural analysis.
* **Data Science**: Processing large-scale scholarly datasets (OpenAlex, MAG, APS) using Python and SQL.
